body.p: Born on June 24, 1828 in Delaware County, Pennsylvania. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1851. Appointed assistant instructor of infantry tactics at West Point in 1857 and again in 1859. When the American Civil War began, Kelton was made Chief Purchasing Commissary at St. Louis. Served as Assistant Adjutant General of the Department of the West with the rank of captain. In the fall of 1861, Commissioned Colonel of the 9th Missouri Volunteers. Resigned his volunteer commission on March 12, 1862. Served as Assistant Adjutant General of the Department of Mississippi in 1862. Appointed to the Adjutant General's Department in April 1865.
